text: Yes what i feel the govt shld do is to use the money to built btr facilities for these banglas who have worked tirelessly to build our country, beneath our hdb and office towers are these men, we shall not treat them like slaves in dubai. Hence, they shld use these money to repay them at least instead of spending them on useless white collared workers who steal our jobs, from THOSE PINOYS IN SINGTEL TO THOSE MALAYSIANS IN OUR FACTORIES AND OFFICES ,we should not spend too much effort on these kinda people as they do not even contribute that much to our nation, and in the end leave our country or complain like some dog like that, i rather pay money to bring up our own batch of singaporean working class.I throw a dog a bone it will also shake its tail, u give these useless people opportunity they oso not grateful ,even coming back to bite u in the neck.These bangals , we make fun of them, discriminate them, but have they ever said no or been impolite to us? answers.text: @poopingwonders I understand with what you are trying to say. Mutually, i agree with some of the points but not all.
@poopingwonders Like i said, i have no problems with them working here and exchanging knowledge with us unless they step over the boundaries. Have a simple respect for our citizens.

@poopingwonders We literally have a word to describe ourselves... ‘kiasu’. I am not totally against foreigners working in Singapore but i am against their actions when they start to take advantage/look down on our own people. If they are kind, well-mannered, good for them. There just need to be a balance between all this and not just a total influx of them being hired everywhere to replace our own Singaporeans just because of revenue.

@poopingwonders I get your point in terms of placing myself in their shoes and i’ve heard this reasoning many times. I still disagree with this part of hiring foreigners instead of Singaporeans for cutting the cost. Yes, in terms of business, it is beneficial for them, but how about the Singaporeans living in Singapore? We are Singaporean, this is our country, we should be the one with the privilege in this kind of matters. You see, cutting cost can lead to the work industry being more competent which can result to higher unemployment rate. How is this beneficial for our country in the long run? How is this beneficial for our people? And let me correct you one last time, i am not the one with the job getting stolen.

@poopingwonders Hmm. It seems like you are supporting my point. “..there are benefits in hiring a foreign worker than a Singaporean citizen btw.” Regardless, we are Singaporean and shouldn’t we be prioritized in the working industry? I know our country support meritocracy but a foreigner having more advantage over a Singaporean even though they both have the same qualification? That just doesn’t seem right. Additionally for more information regarding the context, my friend was fired by the new supervisor and when he asked for a reason, she simply did not gave one. It just doesn’t seem right when a foreigner has more benefits in the work force than our own Singaporeans. I am going to leave the debate here as it is as i am not trying to change anyone’s opinion. Have a nice day.
@poopingwonders Not mine lol. Like i said, someone close to me. I’m still studying fyi.

@delta.m.p wow look at you talking about discrimination while discriminating against pinoys and malaysians. Amusing. Why are u assuming they banglas have NEVER said no or been impolite. Its a fact that the banglas are here only because they need money. They dont actually give a flying fuck about us and neither do you. It may be different in a situation where you might be facing a bangla face to face but generally you dont care about  banglas and they dont care about you. They are compensated for their labour and you respect them as a human being, not for their achievements. You dont look at the class failure and respect him cuz hes going to be a rubbish man, keeping our streets clean. You mock him and label him the class clown or idiot. The double standards here are amusing.

@delta.m.p Totally agree with you. Some of those ungrateful foreign workers stole our jobs. Some of them were even appointed as supervisors and decided to fire the Singaporeans and recruit their people for no reason.(One of the people closest to me experienced it first hand). We should really appreciate those workers more that helped to bring up our country and help them back in return, instead of those ungrateful ones.

@1812.overture ur so stupid bruv. Ur the type of people that are MY problem. Why cant u understand that these people are making our country better step by step? They are doing the best they can. And u here complaining bout this? Wtf? Why cant u appreciate it? U wanna complain so much leave singapore.

@lucckass_ No you are wrong. Without them, other migrant workers would be here. They are replacable and are not loyal. They are here simply for the pay and work prospects. Being nice or evil is just simply being human and its completly irrelevant to why they should be labelled as a hero
@lucckass_ No. Im telling you now I dont care. They are just another community to be infected with the virus.

@jiang_coughlin People like you are my problem. Whats the entire point of this comment section ? Its to make yourself feel better. To let ur friends know you are kind and give a shit. What practical use does this comment section have ? 0. Firstly, do they even have enough money to buy a phone ? If they did, would they download instagram ? If they do, would they understand english ? And IF THEY DID, what are the chances of coming across this post ? Chances are very small. In fact, have you even seen one such instance of any migrant worker giving their thanks and aknowledging your acts of recognition here ? Id guess not.

@1812.overture  wtf is ur issue man? We just trying help them out by giving them recognition at this hard time. U don’t need to make a big deal about when it’s appropriate to call someone a “hero”. Ur argument is very unrealistic and irrelevant!
@1812.overture id like to see you do better. Bet u cant cuz ur busy ranting back at other peoples instagram comments
@1812.overture wtf they are the ones that make singapore a better place. Without then we aren’t gonna be having the nice singapore we have now. Can you not see that?

Why are they heros ? All they did was do their work and earn their pay. The word hero is being loosely used in this comment section and I dont appreciate it.  Assume country X to be identical to singapore. If country X offered a higher salary, would these workers have chosen singapore or country X ? I think thats a no brainer question. Its ok to pretend to care but when one expects me to treat them like a hero who has BUILT OUR COUNTRY ground up, thats a big nono. The real ones who built this country up are the architects, the investors and the relevant ministries. These workers are replacable and are simply here because of the better pay as compared to their hometown. Im not saying dont give them respect. Im saying dont make them seem bigger than they really are. Appreciation is due, while idolisation is not. Also, why are we assuming that every one of these workers are nice and helpful to the public ? Why not post 5 instances of these workers being dicks and then let people weigh it out ?  We dont know the exact ratio of nice things to bad things but does that really justify generalising the entire community as a nice one after seeing just 5 acts of kindness ? These people are driven by the salary and a family to feed. Make no mistake. They will abandon us at will. Just some appreciation is due, and nothing more.

text: here's what I think, many singaporeans start to complain that the govt don't treat foreign workers well enough, but let's step back and think, neither did we really cared before that either. unless u have previously tried to do something to help them, I don't think it's fair to suddenly say that the govt has never cared when we ourselves previously didn't either. Im not saying that this should carry on, because yes, they deserve better. I'm just hoping for a bit more understanding and forgiveness on our part. let's take this as an opportunity to create positive change, not a game of who's to blame. furthermore, before asking the govt to give them more money, let's ask ourselves whether we are really willing to pay more taxes to help them, and let your money go to them instead of Singapore's future savings, your education, etc. there's many things that go beyond what we see. so far, we have been living in peace and life have not been the worst. yes , the govt makes mistakes but if anything , now is a time to cooperate and support. any anger or retaliation, let's wait for this to be over first. stay strong guys, we can overcome it. meanwhile, do help others if u can and stay safe !
